messages.title: Labor's Pledges - Rebuild Britain for the Many Not the Few
content: Increased funding for the NHS with more nurses and doctors to give patients the care they need.
A Real Living Wage of £10 an hour and no increase in Income Tax or National Insurance for 95% of people.
A Green Industrial Revolution creating 400,000 jobs.
Free school meals for all primary school children and reduced class sizes for all 5, 6, and 7 year olds.
Keep the Winter Fuel Allowance, free TV licenses and bus passes for pensioners.
A public vote on any Brexit deal. I will campaign to remain as I did in 2016.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Increased funding for the NHS with more nurses and doctors to give patients the care they need.
A Real Living Wage of £10 an hour and no increase in Income Tax or National Insurance for 95% of people.
A Green Industrial Revolution creating 400,000 jobs.
Free school meals for all primary school children and reduced class sizes for all 5, 6, and 7 year olds.
Keep the Winter Fuel Allowance, free TV licenses and bus passes for pensioners.
A public vote on any Brexit deal. I will campaign to remain as I did in 2016.

mentions.tacticalSituation: At this election you will have a clear choice in Rushcliffe. You will either have a hard Brexit Tory MP or myself, who if elected as your MP, will vote for a second referendum and campaign hard to remain, just as I did in 2016. In 2017 the Lib Dems couldn’t even get 5% of the vote and lost their deposit. Only Labour can beat the Tories in Rushcliffe. Only Labour can beat the Tories in Rushcliffe. Verified by People’s Vote, Gina Miller, Progressive Alliance and Tactical Voting, who are all backing my campaign to beat the Tories in Rushcliffe.

leaflet.personalStatement: Labor's message aligns with providing practical support via NHS funding, improved living wages, green jobs, and a strong stand against hard Brexit.

endorsements.endorsement: Backing my campaign to beat the Tories in Rushcliffe.

quotes.text: Britain is divided. Boris Johnson’s Conservatives and the Liberal Democrats have taken extreme positions on Brexit. Both parties won’t do anything to heal the division in our country.
Only Labour can beat the Tories in Rushcliffe. This has been verified by People’s Vote, Gina Miller, Progressive Alliance and Tactical Voting.

examples: In 2017 the Lib Dems couldn’t even get 5% of the vote and lost their deposit.
Conservatives: 30,223 votes, Labour: 22,213 votes, Lib Dems: 2,759 votes
A Real Living Wage of £10 an hour
Both parties won’t do anything to heal the division in our country.
